item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Under certain circumstances, profanity provides a relief denied even to prayer."
[<i>Mark Twain, a Biography</i>]" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Richard Thompson
item.description: "I’m a fool with a size one head/ I’ll change this heart of mine/ This time, this time" -- Richard Thompson

item.title: Tony add a quote by Laurie Anderson
item.description: "History is an angel being blown backwards into the future" -- Laurie Anderson

item.title: Tony add a quote by Slavoj Žižek
item.description: "as soon as we renounce fiction and illusion, we lose reality itself; the moment we subtract fictions from reality, reality itself loses its discursive-logical consistency." -- Slavoj Žižek

item.title: Tony add a quote by Sarah Silverman
item.description: "Great News! If you quit being cunty the whole world will stop being against you!" -- Sarah Silverman

item.title: Tony add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Let me fall out of the window/ With confetti in my hair" -- Tom Waits

item.title: Tony add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "I danced along a colored wind/ Dangled from a rope of sand" -- Tom Waits

item.title: Tony add a quote by The Mekons
item.description: "History has a stutter./It says w-w-w-watch out." -- The Mekons

item.title: Tony add a quote by William Kennedy
item.description: "Well-lit streets discourage sin, but don't overdo it." -- William Kennedy

item.title: Tony add a quote by William Kennedy
item.description: "Roscoe was spiritually illegal, a bootlegger of the soul, a mythic creature made of words and wit and wild deeds and boundless memory." -- William Kennedy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Our lives, our stories, flowed into one another's, were no longer our own, individual, discrete." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Tony add a quote by William Kennedy
item.description: "Billy's native arrogance might well have been a gift of miffed genes, then come to splendid definition through the tests to which a street like Broadway puts a young man on the make: tests designed to refine a breed, enforce a code, exclude all simps and gumps, and deliver into the city's life a man worthy of functioning in this age of nocturnal supremacy. Men like Billy Phelan, forged in the brass of Broadway, send, in the time of their splendor, telegraphic statements of mission: I, you bums, am a winner. And that message, however devoid of Christ-like other-cheekery, dooms the faint-hearted Scottys of the night, who must sludge along, never knowing how it feels to spill over with the small change of sassiness, how it feels to leave the spillover on the floor, more where that came from, pal. Leave it for the sweeper." -- William Kennedy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "You know what the fellow said – in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and the Renaissance. In Switzerland, they had brotherly love, they had five hundred years of democracy and peace – and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Tony add a quote by Don Roos
item.description: "Say the point of sex isn’t recreation of procreation or any of that stuff. Say it’s concentration. Say it’s supposed to focus your attention on the person you’re sleeping with--like biological hi-lighter. ... Otherwise, there’s just too many people in the world." -- Don Roos

item.title: Tony add a quote by Walker Percy
item.description: "My mother refused to let me fail. So I insisted." -- Walker Percy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Louis Simpson
item.description: "The Open Road goes to the used-car lot." -- Louis Simpson

item.title: Tony add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tony add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "I dont know what happens to country." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description:
"Beauty Is the fume-track of necessity. This thought Is therapeutic.
If, after several Applications, you do not find Relief, consult your family physician" -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Tony add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "whoever approaches his goal dances" -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Here beyond men's judgments all covenants were brittle." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tony add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "I need, therefore I imagine." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: Tony add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tony add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Reserving judgements is a matter of infinite hope." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tony add a quote by Tracy Letts
item.description: "Thank God we can't tell the future. We'd never get out of bed." -- Tracy Letts

item.title: Tony add a quote by Miguel de Unamuno
item.description: "At times to be silent is to lie. You will win because you have enough brute force. But you will not convince. For to convince you need to persuade. And in order to persuade you would need what you lack: Reason and Right" -- Miguel de Unamuno

item.title: Tony add a quote by Miguel de Unamuno
item.description: "The less we read, the more harmful it is what we read." -- Miguel de Unamuno
